concept_description.description: Generic answer to a question.
Finding of a moderately positive result for a TB smear or culture. (Definition from U.S. Centers for Disease Control)
Enrolled in the MDR-TB treatment program
**This is a legacy concept** It is not directly used in version 2.0 of the MDR-TB module, but it used by the migration script.
A workflow in an mdr-tb program. Used by the mdr-tb module.
Generic descriptive answer.
Generic descriptive answer.
A state in the culture status workflow of an mdr-tb program. Used by the mdr-tb module.
A state in the culture status workflow of an mdr-tb program. Used by the mdr-tb module.
A state in the culture status workflow of an mdr-tb program. Used by the mdr-tb module.
Ability of the patient to be healthy enough to walk
Generic answer to a question.
Generic answer to a question.
Patient is currently hospitalized.
A patient whose treatment was interrupted for two or more consecutive months for any reason. (Definition from WHO). Is this defintion for any treatment? ARV and TB? #1565 ABANDONED - TB covers TB
Patient who has returned after the re-treatment has failed (Definition from World Health Organization Guidelines for the programmatic management of drug-resistant TB)
Patient who has returned after the first treatment has failed (Definition from World Health Organization Guidelines for the programmatic management of drug-resistant TB)

A generic answer which is a coded response to a question. If appropriate, there might be a corresponding question which contains this non-coded response (ie. Deliver Location Non-Coded where datatype=text)
A generic, descriptive answer which is a handwritten, non-coded response to a question.
Represents a treatment relapse
Represents a treatment relapse
Concept containing WHO-defined categories for new MDR-TB patients
Exit status for the MDR-TB program for patients who are sensitive to the TB drugs R, H, E, Z and S.
No longer part of a program because they transferred out to another program
A state in the treatment outcome workflow in an mdr-tb program. Used by the mdr-tb module.
Status indicating the patient died while enrolled in a program
The patient is cured and no longer requires treatment
Failure of a therapy or treatment to achieve its end points.
Treatment is complete, but no more specific outcome can be assigned.
Patients that are lost to followup.
Patients that are lost to followup.
Patients that are lost to followup.. boolean question.
A workflow in an mdr-tb program. Used by the mdr-tb module.
Treatment is no longer required.
A WHO-defined categorization of new MDR-TB patients.
An MDR-TB concept relating to a WHO-defined categorization of new patients.
A WHO-defined set of categorizations of new MDR-TB patients.
A workflow in an mdr-tb program. Used by the mdr-tb module.
A state in the patient status workflow of an mdr-tb program. Used by the mdr-tb module.
A state in the patient status workflow of an mdr-tb program. Used by the mdr-tb module.
A state in the patient status workflow of an mdr-tb program. Used by the mdr-tb module.
Patient died.

Terizidone is a combination of two cycloserine molecules. It is an anti-tuberculous drug used in treating multidrug-resistant TB. TERIZIDONE is considered effective in the treatment of TB and may also be useful for the treatment of urinary tract infections including those due to TB. It is recommended for the treatment of MDR-TB patients in both the intensive and continuation phases. Oral bacteriostatic second-line TB med.
Antituberculosis agent used to treat patients with active tuberculosis, usually in combination with other agents.
Isonicotinic acid derivative used in drug-resistant TB treatment. (Short name Pto from WHO)
Number of bacilli in a smear microscopy result
A smear microscopy test type
smear microscopy method
The datetime that a TB DST or culture was started
General finding of a contaminated specimen.
General finding of a positive result.
A TB culture or smear test result
A TB culture or smear test result indicating 1-9 bacilli or cultures present, with the exact number not specified
Finding of a strongly positive result for a TB smear or culture. (Definition from U.S. Centers for Disease Control)
Finding of a weakly positive result for a TB smear or culture. (Definition from U.S. Centers for Disease Control)
Response to a finding or test result.
A TB smear result
A datetime describing when a sample arrives at a Laboratory for testing
A sample collection source for a TB sputum sample
A sputum sample source used in a TB test
Waste matter discharged from the intestines through the anus; excrement (from Dictionary.com)
Matter coughed up and usually ejected from the mouth, including saliva, foreign material, and substances such as mucus or phlegm, from the respiratory tract.

Waste material that is secreted by the kidney, is rich in end products (as urea, uric acid, and creatinine) of protein metabolism together with salts and pigments, and forms a clear amber and usually slightly acid fluid (from Dictionary.com)
Accumulation of serous, purulent, or bloody fluid into the pulmonary cavity.
Gastric Fluid and/or Contents
The serumlike fluid that circulates through the ventricles of the brain, the cavity of the spinal cord, and the subarachnoid space, functioning in shock absorption (from Dictionary.com)
A source of a sputum sample used in a TB test
The source of a sample used in a TB test
The date a TB test is completed
A TB smear result
HIV/AIDS drugs
A DST test method
Phenazine derivative used in drug-resistant TB treatment. (Short name from WHO)
A crystalline phenolic alcohol C8H11NO3 of the vitamin B6 group found especially in cereals and convertible in the body into pyridoxal and pyridoxamine.
Semisynthetic antibiotic often used in tuberculosis, leprosy and meningococcal treatment/prophylaxis. Also commonly known as Rifampin.

An antibiotic organic base C21H39N7O12 that is produced by a soil actinomycete of the genus Streptomyces (S. griseus), is active against bacteria, and is used especially in the treatment of infections (as tuberculosis) by gram-negative bacteria.
Isonicotinic acid derivative used in drug-resistant TB treatment. (Short name from WHO)
Answer on encounter form. Implies that a patient's current drugs will be changed to meet a new formulation.
A fluoroquinolone C17H18FN3O3 that is often administered in the form of its hydrochloride and is effective especially against gram-negative bacteria.
Descriptive quality.
used to describe a non-coded type of bacteria found in a DST or culture
used to describe a non-coded type of bacteria found in a DST
An organism, but not mycobacterial.
An organism, but not mycobacterial
Slow-growing acid fast bacillus (AFB) and found in tap water.
type of bacteria found in a TB DST test
Type of bacteria found in a TB DST test.
Type of organism found in a mycobacteria culture
Type of organism found in a TB DST test
The patient's treatment was stopped.
A TB test culture method
A preparation of amoxicillin and the potassium salt of clavulanic acid to provide beta-lactam resistance.
Treatment was started, but then later discontinued by the patient.
A crystalline antibacterial compound (C6H7N3O) used in the treatment of tuberculosis.

reinforcement TB med with unclear efficacy. Clarithromycin is a macrolide antibiotic used to treat pharyngitis, tonsillitis, acute maxillary sinusitis, acute bacterial exacerbation of chronic bronchitis, pneumonia (especially atypical pneumonias associated with Chlamydia pneumoniae or TWAR), skin and skin structure infections, and, in HIV and AIDS patients to prevent, and to treat, disseminated Mycobacterium avium complex (MAC). In addition, it is sometimes used to treat Legionellosis.
EMPIRIQUE, STANDARDISE, INDIVIDUALISE
EMPIRIQUE, STANDARDISE, INDIVIDUALISE
EMPIRIQUE, STANDARDISE, INDIVIDUALISE
Anit-folate used in drug-resistant TB treatment. (Short name from WHO)
A thiosaemicarbazone that is used in association with other antimycobacterial agents in the initial and continuation phases of antituberculosis regimens
A synthetic antiretroviral nucleoside (C10H12N2O4) that is an analog of thymidine and is administered orally in the treatment of HIV infection.
Antibiotic that stops multiplication of bacteria by preventing the reproduction and repair of their genetic material. It is in a class of antibiotics called fluoroquinolones.
A typical regimen for a child with HIV
Measure of CD4 (T-helper cells) in blood
D-Alanine analog used in drug-resistant TB treatment. (Short name from WHO)
Antiretroviral combination drug (Zidovudine & Lamivudine)
Cyclic polypeptide used in drug-resistant TB treatment. (Short name from WHO)
Fluoroquinolone used in drug-resistant TB treatment. (Short name from WHO)
Flouroquinilone antibiotic.
Describes family of tuberculosis treatment drugs, NOT quniolones in general.
Aminoglycoside used in drug-resistant TB treatment. (Short name from WHO)
Anti-mycobaterial drug used to treat active tuberculosis. Always used with other antimycobacterial agents.
Reinforcement TB med with unclear efficacy. Rifabutin is a bactericidal antibiotic drug primarily used in the treatment of tuberculosis.
Injectable aminoglycoside used in drug-resistant TB treatment. Inhibits protein synthesis through disruption of ribosomal function. (Short name from WHO)
A basic polypeptide antibiotic (trade name Viocin) administered intramuscularly (along with other drugs) in the treatment of tuberculosis
Fluoroquinolone used in drug-resistant TB treatment. (Short name from WHO)
Fluoroquinolone used in drug-resistant TB treatment. (Short name from WHO)
drugs to which a TB patient has tested to be susceptible
Generic answer to a question. Patient knows that they are on an antiretroviral medicine, but does not know the name of it, and it hasn't been specified on the encounter form.
This would be used when you're changing the patient's ARV regimen because they're starting TB meds
There is no money for medication -- this should never be the case for PIH since we don't charge poor people for medicine. Why would we? However -- this is an IMAI reason for poor adherence.
A nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor (NRTI) that prevents HIV from altering the genetic material of healthy T-cells.
Used to describe a non-coded type of organism identified in a TB DST or culture
Direct or indirect method used in a DST test for TB. True = Direct, False = Indirect
The number of colonies found in the control of a DST test
A DST test method
A TB culture test method
A DST test type
A tuberculosis DST test method
A DST TEST TYPE
A concept set of methods used to preform a TB DST
Lists anti-tuberculous drugs to which a patient is resistant
Used to describe a concentration in a DST test. Maps to datatype double.
Describes the number of colonies found in a DST test
An intermediate DST result
The concept containing the result of each row of a TB DST test. Contains results, as well as concepts containing DST test metadata.
This is the master concept set containing all metadata and results for a DST
The patient's weight has changed and the drug order might need to change
Adverse reaction to a drug (oral, parenteral, topical).
A patient whose treatment was interrupted for two or more consecutive months for any reason. (Definition from WHO)
Descriptive term: not precisely defined, determinable, or established.

Patients who were smear and culture negative before the onset of treatment and thereafter, and have completed a full course of treatment. Patients who were smear and/or culture positive before the onset of treatment and have completed a full course of anti-tuberculosis chemotherapy but failed to have the required number of negative smears and/or cultures. (Definition from WHO)
No test was performed
Combination of two medications in a category of HIV antriretrovirals called protease inhibitors. Lopinavir and ritonavir prevent HIV from multiplying.
Answer to question. Implies that a person completed a course of total prevention of mother to child transmission therapy.
This is the period when the regimen is changed from all first line drugs to something less.
A TB culture method
The method used to perform a culture when performing a TB test
the result of a TB culture
A protease-inhibiting drug usually used in combination with other drugs to suppress the replication of HIV.
Combination antiretroviral drug.
Question: Does the patient have pulmonary TB, where the TB is relating to, or affecting the lungs.
Diagnosis of extra-pulmonary tuberculosis, where the TB is not relating to, or affecting the lungs.
Describes the site of TB disease
Three-drug cocktail used in treating HIV
A patient who is suspected to have MDR-TB, but this has not been confirmed by a DST. Used by the mdr-tb module. In the concept set TUBERCULOSIS CASE CLASSIFICATION.
Patient pulse rate, as measured with a peripheral oximeter.
Patient pulse rate, as measured with a peripheral oximeter or by palpation.
This could be a reason for poor adherence, regimen change or stop

Belongs to a class of drugs called Nucleotide Reverse Transcriptase Inhibitors (NtRTI). The body converts these meds into a chemical that prevents HIV from reproducing in uninfected cells, but it does not help cells that have already been infected with the virus.
A non-nucleoside drug used to treat HIV infection.
Measured respiratory rate in breaths per minute
A nucleoside analogue antiviral drug that inhibits replication of retroviruses such as HIV by interfering with the enzyme reverse transcriptase.
Generic answer to encounter form questions.. another retroviral drug not already specified in the antiretroviral set (term 1085).
Patient's weight in kilograms.
Patient's weight in kilograms.
The patient decided not to start treatment
A nucleoside analogue antiviral drug that inhibits the replication of retroviruses such as HIV by interfering with the enzyme reverse transcriptase.
A non-nucleoside analogue that is used as an antiviral drug in the treatment of HIV infection.
The patient decided to change treatment, but for a reason not on the list. IMAI required choice.
The period from conception to birth when a woman carries a developing fetus in her uterus.
New Concept Set to be used in the MDR-TB dashboard drug regimen pages. The concepts in this set can be used to tailor all possible TB drug choices in the drug dropdown when adding a TB drug order.
Used on haitimdr instead of TUBERCULOSIS TREATMENT DRUGS
Corresponds to the working WHO definition for XDR TB.
A concept corresponding to the WHO working definition for MDR-TB.
The patient hasn't been able to adher to a regimen.
This could be a reason for regimen change or stop
Reason for a change in anti-TB regimen

Patients are considered as cured if his/her smear/culture was positive before the onset of treatment, if they have completed a course of anti-tuberculosis chemotherapy and their smear/culture is negative at 5 or more months of treatment and at the end of treatment.(Definition from WHO)
Describes resistant result in drug sensitivity testing for tuberculosis
Question on encounter form. Part of the plan gathers a reason for stopping TB prophylactic drugs. This concept captures that information.
An antiviral drug (C8H11N3O3S) that is a synthetic nucleoside analog acting against HIV by inhibiting reverse transcriptase.
Result of PCR or rapid test
For some reason, the drug prescription was interrupted
The date a sputum sample is taken from a patient in order to perform a TB microscopy, culture, or DST
An ACTIVE infection with the bacteria mycobacterium tuberculosis, site not specified.
An ACTIVE infection with the bacteria mycobacterium tuberculosis, site not specified.
Patient's temperature in degrees centigrade.
Free text for non coded clinical impressions
Patient is to return on this date
A patient shows side effects of treatment
Coded answer to indicate that the patient is pregnant
A simple boolean used to track coinfection among mdr-tb patients. Used by the mdr-tb module.
A mode of admission
Question on encounter form. Part of the plan gathers a reason for stopping ARVs. This concept captures that information.
An electronic copy of a lab test result report.
A patient's systolic blood pressure measurement (taken with a manual cuff in either a sitting or standing position)
Set which contains all drugs used to treat HIV.

The set of all concepts used by the MDR-TB module, version 2.0. All concepts used by the module are either members of this set directly, or are dependencies of the members of this set. (i.e, concept answers or set members of these top-level concepts) That is, exporting this set and all it's dependencies via the Metadata Sharing module should create a package of all concepts required to use the module.
